content.webTitle: Fifa beats credit crunch with £127m profit

fields.headline: Fifa beats credit crunch with £127m profit
fields.bodyText: Fifa insists it has not been damaged by the global credit crisis after announcing profits of $184m (£127m) in 2008. Their annual financial report says it had an income of $957m (£663m) last year, 94% of which was generated by television, marketing and sponsorship money raised from events such as the World Cup. Football's world governing body said it even made a profit of $16m (£11m) in managing its assets. The organisation's equity now stands at $902m (£625m). It was boosted by a successful policy of hedging foreign currency, according to the report.
